messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] that rusty dragon tsuba again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/11/2003 4:08:31 PM Central Daylight Time, jggilbert@EARTHLINK.NET writes: Milt, The guard looks a lot better now.  I m not sure about the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/11/2003 4:08:31 PM Central Daylight Time,
jggilbert@... writes:
Milt,
The guard looks a lot better now. I'm not sure about the arm, but it looks
like there's a cloud missing from the back in the lower left quadrant. That is
an unusual rim.

Jim
Jim und all,
Yes, a big cloud is definitely missing on the flip side, 7 O'clock area.
If you klick on the detail of dragon pic..........the full size pic will show
you why I suspect the left forearm is missing. The carving of the dragon
seems to be " depressed" there, not consistent with the rest of the scales.
There are definitely traces of lacquer at the rim, I managed to preserved
that.
Also near the kogai hitsu-ana, you can see three " lines " of remaining
lacquer.

Milt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] that rusty dragon tsuba again
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, The guard looks a lot better now.  I m not sure about the arm, but it looks like there s a cloud missing from the back in the lower left quadrant.  That
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
The guard looks a lot better now. I'm not sure about the arm, but it looks like there's a cloud missing from the back in the lower left quadrant. That is an unusual rim.

Jim



gang,
posted more ( hopefully better ) pics.

http://tinyurl.com/mybc

top horizontal row............ before /after pics ( rust removal )
using flash.

Bottom row............ pics taken under natural( available ) light
which reflect more of the actual color of the tsuba.
Last pic to the far right is the mimi, the shiny spots are the black
lacquer remaining.

the close up of the dragon....at 2 O'clock area you can see what I
think is the missing left forearm of the dragon.


milt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
